result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Francis Anthony Kosobucki Jr

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:47 PM Defendant Francis Anthony Kosobucki Jr in court.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Public defender has not appointed counsel yet. Defendant wishes to complete the PFAC forms.  Court hands the defendant the PFAC forms. Court finds good cause to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Anthony Hauschultz, 2016 Marshall Street, #B, Manitowoc, WI   54220.

Order to Amend Bail.
As stated on the record, the cash bail previously set at $500.00 has been amended to $50.00 cash.  All conditions remain as set.
AMENDED Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

4:31 pm - Defendant Francis Anthony Kosobucki Jr appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Public defender has not appointed counsel yet.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits.  The defendant decides he wants to go the court appointed attorney route and will complete and file the paperwork.  
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
The State objects to any modification.
Court modifies bail to $50.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with Jason Twieg.  
State to draft order.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-07-22 at 4:00 p.m.    
Minutes.
Re:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 08-20-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. felony bail jumping and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with Jason Tweig.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.
